segment.source: MD Conversion - Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: can help you to secure your managed computers in a number of ways, including the management of software updates that keep your computers up to date by ensuring the latest patches and software updates are quickly installed.
segment.target: can help you to secure your managed computers in a number of ways, including the management of software updates that keep your computers up to date by ensuring the latest patches and software updates are quickly installed.

segment.source: If you have not yet installed the client on your computers, see Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: If you have not yet installed the client on your computers, see Install the Windows PC client with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: When new updates are available from Microsoft Update, or you have created a third-party update, and they are applicable to your managed computers, a notification is displayed on the Overview page of the Updates workspace.
segment.target: When new updates are available from Microsoft Update, or you have created a third-party update, and they are applicable to your managed computers, a notification is displayed on the Overview page of the Updates workspace.

segment.source: After you click this notification link, you can then perform various operations like viewing more information about the update, approving or declining the update, and viewing the computers that will install the update if it is approved.
segment.target: After you click this notification link, you can then perform various operations like viewing more information about the update, approving or declining the update, and viewing the computers that will install the update if it is approved.

segment.source: The Updates workspace is not displayed in the administrator console until you have installed the client on, and are successfully managing at least one computer client.
segment.target: The Updates workspace is not displayed in the administrator console until you have installed the client on, and are successfully managing at least one computer client.

segment.source: As updates are approved and installed, you can examine the success or failure of the installation in the Updates workspace of the console.
segment.target: As updates are approved and installed, you can examine the success or failure of the installation in the Updates workspace of the console.

segment.source: The following sections will help you to keep software up to date on your managed computers.
segment.target: The following sections will help you to keep software up to date on your managed computers.

segment.source: Before you start
segment.target: Before you start

segment.source: Before you begin to create and approve software updates, configure and deploy polices to your computers that control when and how the updates are installed.
segment.target: Before you begin to create and approve software updates, configure and deploy polices to your computers that control when and how the updates are installed.

segment.source: To configure update policy settings
segment.target: To configure update policy settings

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Overview > Add Policy.

segment.source: Configure and deploy a Microsoft Intune Agent Settings policy for the update settings.
segment.target: Configure and deploy a Microsoft Intune Agent Settings policy for the update settings.

segment.source: You can use recommended settings or customize the settings.
segment.target: You can use recommended settings or customize the settings.

segment.source: If you need more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client topic.
segment.target: If you need more information about how to create and deploy policies, see the Common Windows PC management tasks with the Microsoft Intune computer client topic.

segment.source: The following table shows the values you can configure in the policy and also the recommended values that will be used if you don’t customize the policy.
segment.target: The following table shows the values you can configure in the policy and also the recommended values that will be used if you don’t customize the policy.

segment.source: You can find these settings in the Updates section.
segment.target: You can find these settings in the Updates section.

segment.source: Policy setting
segment.target: Policy setting

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Update and application detection frequency (hours)
segment.target: Update and application detection frequency (hours)

segment.source: Specifies how frequently (from 8-22 hours) checks for new updates and applications.
segment.target: Specifies how frequently (from 8-22 hours) checks for new updates and applications.

segment.source: Recommended value: 8 hours.
segment.target: Recommended value: 8 hours.

segment.source: Automated or prompted installation of updates and applications
segment.target: Automated or prompted installation of updates and applications

segment.source: Specifies whether updates are installed automatically or whether the user is prompted before installation.
segment.target: Specifies whether updates are installed automatically or whether the user is prompted before installation.

segment.source: Additionally, this setting lets you schedule the installation of updates and applications.
segment.target: Additionally, this setting lets you schedule the installation of updates and applications.

segment.source: Install updates and applications automatically as scheduled installs updates and applications using the specified schedule.
segment.target: Install updates and applications automatically as scheduled installs updates and applications using the specified schedule.

segment.source: As a dependent policy setting, Use Automatic Maintenance for Windows computers specifies that updates and applications are installed during the Windows Automatic maintenance window.
segment.target: As a dependent policy setting, Use Automatic Maintenance for Windows computers specifies that updates and applications are installed during the Windows Automatic maintenance window.

segment.source: Prompt user for installation prompts the user to install updates when they are ready.
segment.target: Prompt user for installation prompts the user to install updates when they are ready.

segment.source: Recommended values:
segment.target: Recommended values:

segment.source: Install updates and applications automatically as scheduled selected
segment.target: Install updates and applications automatically as scheduled selected

segment.source: Day scheduled: Every day
segment.target: Day scheduled: Every day

segment.source: Time scheduled: 3:00 AM
segment.target: Time scheduled: 3:00 AM

segment.source: Use Automatic Maintenance for Windows computers selected
segment.target: Use Automatic Maintenance for Windows computers selected

segment.source: Allow immediate installation of updates that do not interrupt Windows
segment.target: Allow immediate installation of updates that do not interrupt Windows

segment.source: Allow installs updates immediately after they are downloaded, except for updates that would interrupt or restart Windows.
segment.target: Allow installs updates immediately after they are downloaded, except for updates that would interrupt or restart Windows.

segment.source: Those updates are installed according to the configuration of the Automated or prompted installation of updates setting.
segment.target: Those updates are installed according to the configuration of the Automated or prompted installation of updates setting.

segment.source: Do not allow installs updates according to the configuration of the Automated or prompted installation of updates setting.
segment.target: Do not allow installs updates according to the configuration of the Automated or prompted installation of updates setting.

segment.source: Recommended value: Allow
segment.target: Recommended value: Allow

segment.source: Delay to restart Windows after installation of scheduled updates and applications (minutes)
segment.target: Delay to restart Windows after installation of scheduled updates and applications (minutes)

segment.source: Specifies (from 1-30 minutes), the time to wait to restart Windows after the installation of scheduled updates and applications.
segment.target: Specifies (from 1-30 minutes), the time to wait to restart Windows after the installation of scheduled updates and applications.

segment.source: Recommended value: 15 minutes
segment.target: Recommended value: 15 minutes

segment.source: Delay following Windows restart to begin installing missed scheduled updates and applications (minutes)
segment.target: Delay following Windows restart to begin installing missed scheduled updates and applications (minutes)

segment.source: Specifies (from 1-60 minutes), how long to wait to start the installation of updates and applications after Windows is restarted when a scheduled update was missed.
segment.target: Specifies (from 1-60 minutes), how long to wait to start the installation of updates and applications after Windows is restarted when a scheduled update was missed.

segment.source: Recommended value: 5 minutes
segment.target: Recommended value: 5 minutes

segment.source: Allow logged-on user to control Windows restart after installation of scheduled updates and applications
segment.target: Allow logged-on user to control Windows restart after installation of scheduled updates and applications

segment.source: Specifies whether the logged-on user can delay restarting Windows (if set to Yes), or be notified of the automatic Windows restart (if set to No).
segment.target: Specifies whether the logged-on user can delay restarting Windows (if set to Yes), or be notified of the automatic Windows restart (if set to No).

segment.source: If no user is logged on when the scheduled installation of updates and applications is completed, Windows is restarted automatically when required.
segment.target: If no user is logged on when the scheduled installation of updates and applications is completed, Windows is restarted automatically when required.

segment.source: When set to No, by default, the time before Windows restarts is set to 5 minutes.
segment.target: When set to No, by default, the time before Windows restarts is set to 5 minutes.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Prompt user to restart Windows during client agent mandatory updates
segment.target: Prompt user to restart Windows during client agent mandatory updates

segment.source: Specifies whether the logged on users is prompted to restart Windows when a client mandatory update requires Windows to restart.
segment.target: Specifies whether the logged on users is prompted to restart Windows when a client mandatory update requires Windows to restart.

segment.source: Recommended value: Yes
segment.target: Recommended value: Yes

segment.source: Microsoft Intune client agent mandatory updates installation schedule
segment.target: Microsoft Intune client agent mandatory updates installation schedule

segment.source: Schedules when the installation of client updates occur.
segment.target: Schedules when the installation of client updates occur.

segment.source: Recommended value: not configured
segment.target: Recommended value: not configured

segment.source: Delay between prompts to restart Windows after installation of scheduled updates and applications (minutes)
segment.target: Delay between prompts to restart Windows after installation of scheduled updates and applications (minutes)

segment.source: Specifies how frequently (from 1-1440 minutes) the user is prompted to restart Windows when a scheduled update or application that requires restarting Windows is installed, and the user delays the restart.
segment.target: Specifies how frequently (from 1-1440 minutes) the user is prompted to restart Windows when a scheduled update or application that requires restarting Windows is installed, and the user delays the restart.

segment.source: Recommended value: 30 minutes
segment.target: Recommended value: 30 minutes

segment.source: Updating software made by Microsoft
segment.target: Updating software made by Microsoft

segment.source: Updating Microsoft software requires very little work from you.
segment.target: Updating Microsoft software requires very little work from you.

segment.source: However, before you start, there are two things you should configure:
segment.target: However, before you start, there are two things you should configure:

segment.source: Product categories and update classifications – Defines the categories and classifications of the updates you want to make available to computers.
segment.target: Product categories and update classifications – Defines the categories and classifications of the updates you want to make available to computers.

segment.source: For example, you might decide that you only want critical updates for Microsoft Office to be installed.
segment.target: For example, you might decide that you only want critical updates for Microsoft Office to be installed.

segment.source: Automatic approval rules – These rules automatically approve specified types of update and reduce your administrative overhead.
segment.target: Automatic approval rules – These rules automatically approve specified types of update and reduce your administrative overhead.

segment.source: For example, you might want to automatically approve all critical software updates.
segment.target: For example, you might want to automatically approve all critical software updates.

segment.source: Use the following two procedures to help you get ready to use software updates:
segment.target: Use the following two procedures to help you get ready to use software updates:

segment.source: Configure the product categories and update classifications you want to make available to managed computers
segment.target: Configure the product categories and update classifications you want to make available to managed computers

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Updates.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Updates.

segment.source: On the Service Settings: Updates page, in the Product Category list, select the update categories that you want to make available to computers.
segment.target: On the Service Settings: Updates page, in the Product Category list, select the update categories that you want to make available to computers.

segment.source: Note that the most common updates are selected by default.
segment.target: Note that the most common updates are selected by default.

segment.source: To ensure that computers receive the updates that have been approved by the admin, the Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) Group Policy setting, Specify Intranet Microsoft update service location must not be applied to computers that have been enrolled with .
segment.target: To ensure that computers receive the updates that have been approved by the admin, the Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) Group Policy setting, Specify Intranet Microsoft update service location must not be applied to computers that have been enrolled with .

segment.source: In the Update Classification list, select the classes of update that you want to make available to managed computers.
segment.target: In the Update Classification list, select the classes of update that you want to make available to managed computers.

segment.source: Again, the most common options are selected by default.
segment.target: Again, the most common options are selected by default.

segment.source: Click Save to store your selections.
segment.target: Click Save to store your selections.

segment.source: To configure automatic approval rules for software updates
segment.target: To configure automatic approval rules for software updates

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Updates.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Updates.

segment.source: In the Automatic Approval Rules section of the Server Settings: Updates page, click New.
segment.target: In the Automatic Approval Rules section of the Server Settings: Updates page, click New.

segment.source: On the General page of the Create Automatic Approval Rule Wizard, specify a name and optional description for the rule.
segment.target: On the General page of the Create Automatic Approval Rule Wizard, specify a name and optional description for the rule.

segment.source: On the Product Categories page, select any products for which you want to have updates approved automatically.
segment.target: On the Product Categories page, select any products for which you want to have updates approved automatically.

segment.source: On the Update Classifications page, specify the update classifications that you want to have approved automatically.
segment.target: On the Update Classifications page, specify the update classifications that you want to have approved automatically.

segment.source: On the Deployment page, do the following:
segment.target: On the Deployment page, do the following:

segment.source: Select the computer groups to which you want to deploy the new rule, and then click Add.
segment.target: Select the computer groups to which you want to deploy the new rule, and then click Add.

segment.source: To specify an installation deadline for the updates, select the Enforce an installation deadline for these updates check box, and then on the Installation deadline list, select the installation deadline.
segment.target: To specify an installation deadline for the updates, select the Enforce an installation deadline for these updates check box, and then on the Installation deadline list, select the installation deadline.

segment.source: If you specify an installation deadline, the managed computer might require one or more restarts after the deadline interval has passed.
segment.target: If you specify an installation deadline, the managed computer might require one or more restarts after the deadline interval has passed.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Next.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Next.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the settings for the new rule, and then click Finish.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the settings for the new rule, and then click Finish.

segment.source: The new rule is shown in the Automatic Approval Rules section of the Service Settings: Updates page.
segment.target: The new rule is shown in the Automatic Approval Rules section of the Service Settings: Updates page.

segment.source: When you create an automatic approval rule, it only approves future updates, and does not automatically approve previously existing updates that already exist in .
segment.target: When you create an automatic approval rule, it only approves future updates, and does not automatically approve previously existing updates that already exist in .

segment.source: To approve these updates you need to run the automatic approval rule.
segment.target: To approve these updates you need to run the automatic approval rule.

segment.source: For more information, see To edit, run, or delete an automatically approved update rule below.
segment.target: For more information, see To edit, run, or delete an automatically approved update rule below.

segment.source: To edit, run, or delete an automatically approved update rule
segment.target: To edit, run, or delete an automatically approved update rule

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Updates.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Admin > Updates.

segment.source: In the Automatic Approval Rules section, select a rule, and then do one of the following:
segment.target: In the Automatic Approval Rules section, select a rule, and then do one of the following:

segment.source: To edit the rule, click Edit, and then change the rule’s parameters in the Update Auto Approval Rule Wizard.
segment.target: To edit the rule, click Edit, and then change the rule’s parameters in the Update Auto Approval Rule Wizard.

segment.source: To run the rule, click Run Selected.
segment.target: To run the rule, click Run Selected.

segment.source: To delete the rule, click Delete.
segment.target: To delete the rule, click Delete.

segment.source: Deleting a rule does not affect previous updates that were approved by the deleted rule.
segment.target: Deleting a rule does not affect previous updates that were approved by the deleted rule.

segment.source: Updating software not made by Microsoft
segment.target: Updating software not made by Microsoft

segment.source: You can deploy updates for software that is not made by Microsoft.
segment.target: You can deploy updates for software that is not made by Microsoft.

segment.source: You do this by using the Upload Update wizard to get the update into your Cloud Storage space, after which you can approve or decline the update just like with Microsoft software.
segment.target: You do this by using the Upload Update wizard to get the update into your Cloud Storage space, after which you can approve or decline the update just like with Microsoft software.

segment.source: To upload and configure a third-party update
segment.target: To upload and configure a third-party update

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Updates > Overview > Upload.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Updates > Overview > Upload.

segment.source: On the Update files page, click Browse to select the setup files that are required to install the update package.
segment.target: On the Update files page, click Browse to select the setup files that are required to install the update package.

segment.source: The file can be a Windows Installer (.msi) file, a Windows Installer patch (.msp) file, or a .exe program file.
segment.target: The file can be a Windows Installer (.msi) file, a Windows Installer patch (.msp) file, or a .exe program file.

segment.source: You can also include any additional files or folders that are in the same folder as the setup file.
segment.target: You can also include any additional files or folders that are in the same folder as the setup file.

segment.source: The total size of the selected files to upload is displayed.
segment.target: The total size of the selected files to upload is displayed.

segment.source: Note that this size does not include the uncompressed or expanded sizes of installation files.
segment.target: Note that this size does not include the uncompressed or expanded sizes of installation files.

segment.source: After you specify the setup files, the Update description page displays the name, description, and classification for software information that extracted from the software setup files.
segment.target: After you specify the setup files, the Update description page displays the name, description, and classification for software information that extracted from the software setup files.

segment.source: You can select a classification to label the type of update you are deploying (Updates, Critical Updates, Security Updates, Update Rollups or Service Packs).
segment.target: You can select a classification to label the type of update you are deploying (Updates, Critical Updates, Security Updates, Update Rollups or Service Packs).

segment.source: Click Next when you are done.
segment.target: Click Next when you are done.

segment.source: On the Requirements page of the wizard, choose the architecture (32-bit, 64-bit, or both), and the operating systems of the managed computers to which this update will be applicable.
segment.target: On the Requirements page of the wizard, choose the architecture (32-bit, 64-bit, or both), and the operating systems of the managed computers to which this update will be applicable.

segment.source: On the Detection rules page, specify how determines whether the update already exists on managed computers.
segment.target: On the Detection rules page, specify how determines whether the update already exists on managed computers.

segment.source: If you use the default option, Use the default detection rules, always installs the update package on each targeted computer once.
segment.target: If you use the default option, Use the default detection rules, always installs the update package on each targeted computer once.

segment.source: If the update setup file that you specified is a Windows Installer or .msp file, the Detection rules page of the wizard does not appear.
segment.target: If the update setup file that you specified is a Windows Installer or .msp file, the Detection rules page of the wizard does not appear.

segment.source: This is because Windows Installer and .msp files contain their own instructions for detecting previous update installations.
segment.target: This is because Windows Installer and .msp files contain their own instructions for detecting previous update installations.

segment.source: Select one or more of the following rules to determine whether the update is already installed on managed computers:
segment.target: Select one or more of the following rules to determine whether the update is already installed on managed computers:

segment.source: File exists
segment.target: File exists

segment.source: MSI product code exists
segment.target: MSI product code exists

segment.source: Registry key exists
segment.target: Registry key exists

segment.source: Provide any further information that is required to configure the detection rule such as a file path and name, Windows Installer product code, or a registry key, and then click Next.
segment.target: Provide any further information that is required to configure the detection rule such as a file path and name, Windows Installer product code, or a registry key, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Prerequisites page of the wizard, you specify any software that must already be installed before this update can be installed.
segment.target: On the Prerequisites page of the wizard, you specify any software that must already be installed before this update can be installed.

segment.source: You can specify None, select a software package that has already been added to, and is managed by , or you can specify one of the following rules to describe the software:
segment.target: You can specify None, select a software package that has already been added to, and is managed by , or you can specify one of the following rules to describe the software:

segment.source: File exists
segment.target: File exists

segment.source: MSI product code exists
segment.target: MSI product code exists

segment.source: Registry key exists
segment.target: Registry key exists

segment.source: Provide any further information that is required to configure the detection rule like a file path and name, Windows Installer product code, or a registry key, and then click Next.
segment.target: Provide any further information that is required to configure the detection rule like a file path and name, Windows Installer product code, or a registry key, and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Command line arguments page of the wizard, you can add any required installation properties to the installation command line to modify the behavior of the setup file.
segment.target: On the Command line arguments page of the wizard, you can add any required installation properties to the installation command line to modify the behavior of the setup file.

segment.source: For example, some software supports the /q property to enable silent installation.
segment.target: For example, some software supports the /q property to enable silent installation.

segment.source: Refer to the documentation for your software package to learn about any supported command line arguments.
segment.target: Refer to the documentation for your software package to learn about any supported command line arguments.

segment.source: Specify any command line arguments you need and then click Next.
segment.target: Specify any command line arguments you need and then click Next.

segment.source: If the update does not support silent installation, you cannot install the update by using .
segment.target: If the update does not support silent installation, you cannot install the update by using .

segment.source: On the Return codes page of the wizard, you can specify how return codes from the update installation are interpreted.
segment.target: On the Return codes page of the wizard, you can specify how return codes from the update installation are interpreted.

segment.source: By default, uses industry-standard return codes to report a failed or successful installation of an update package.
segment.target: By default, uses industry-standard return codes to report a failed or successful installation of an update package.

segment.source: The supplied return codes are:
segment.target: The supplied return codes are:

segment.source: Return code
segment.target: Return code

segment.source: Interpretation
segment.target: Interpretation

segment.source: Success
segment.target: Success

segment.source: Success with restart
segment.target: Success with restart

segment.source: Any return code that is not listed is considered a failure.
segment.target: Any return code that is not listed is considered a failure.

segment.source: Some updates use nonstandard interpretations for return codes.
segment.target: Some updates use nonstandard interpretations for return codes.

segment.source: In this case, you can specify your own return code interpretations.
segment.target: In this case, you can specify your own return code interpretations.

segment.source: Specify or edit the required return codes and then click Next.
segment.target: Specify or edit the required return codes and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Summary page of the wizard, review the actions that will be taken, and then click Upload to complete the wizard.
segment.target: On the Summary page of the wizard, review the actions that will be taken, and then click Upload to complete the wizard.

segment.source: The uploaded update is stored in the Cloud Storage that you purchased.
segment.target: The uploaded update is stored in the Cloud Storage that you purchased.

segment.source: If you have insufficient free space to upload the update package, you are notified of this during the upload process.
segment.target: If you have insufficient free space to upload the update package, you are notified of this during the upload process.

segment.source: cannot determine sufficient free space until after the update upload has started, because compressed setup and installation files require more space when they are uncompressed.
segment.target: cannot determine sufficient free space until after the update upload has started, because compressed setup and installation files require more space when they are uncompressed.

segment.source: After it is uploaded into , a third-party update is displayed in the Updates workspace in the All Updates pane.
segment.target: After it is uploaded into , a third-party update is displayed in the Updates workspace in the All Updates pane.

segment.source: You can then approve and deploy the update.
segment.target: You can then approve and deploy the update.

segment.source: For more information, see the Approving and declining updates section in this topic.
segment.target: For more information, see the Approving and declining updates section in this topic.

segment.source: Approving and declining updates
segment.target: Approving and declining updates

segment.source: When updates are ready to install, a message is shown on the Updates Overview page of the Updates workspace, under Update Status.
segment.target: When updates are ready to install, a message is shown on the Updates Overview page of the Updates workspace, under Update Status.

segment.source: Click this message to open the All Updates page to see which updates are ready for approval.
segment.target: Click this message to open the All Updates page to see which updates are ready for approval.

segment.source: You can use the Filters list to make it easier to find updates.
segment.target: You can use the Filters list to make it easier to find updates.

segment.source: For example, you can display only updates that failed, or updates that are superseded.
segment.target: For example, you can display only updates that failed, or updates that are superseded.

segment.source: When you select an update from the list, further commands are available that let you manage updates as shown in the following table:
segment.target: When you select an update from the list, further commands are available that let you manage updates as shown in the following table:

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: View Properties
segment.target: View Properties

segment.source: Displays detailed information about the update including the number of computers to which it is applicable.
segment.target: Displays detailed information about the update including the number of computers to which it is applicable.

segment.source: Edit
segment.target: Edit

segment.source: For non-Microsoft updates only.
segment.target: For non-Microsoft updates only.

segment.source: Allows you to edit the properties of the update.
segment.target: Allows you to edit the properties of the update.

segment.source: Approve
segment.target: Approve

segment.source: Approves the selected update and allows you to configure which groups is will be deployed to.
segment.target: Approves the selected update and allows you to configure which groups is will be deployed to.

segment.source: For more information, see the procedure To approve updates in this topic.
segment.target: For more information, see the procedure To approve updates in this topic.

segment.source: Decline
segment.target: Decline

segment.source: Removes any previous approvals for the update and hides the update from the default views.
segment.target: Removes any previous approvals for the update and hides the update from the default views.

segment.source: Additionally, any report data for the update will be removed.
segment.target: Additionally, any report data for the update will be removed.

segment.source: If you later want to locate a declined update, set the filter on the All Updates page to Declined.
segment.target: If you later want to locate a declined update, set the filter on the All Updates page to Declined.

segment.source: You can then approve this update as required.
segment.target: You can then approve this update as required.

segment.source: If an update was declined because the update was expired in Microsoft Update, that update cannot be approved in the .
segment.target: If an update was declined because the update was expired in Microsoft Update, that update cannot be approved in the .

segment.source: If you delete an updates policy that is deployed to computers, the values of those updates policy settings are reset to the default state for the operating system that is installed on the computers.
segment.target: If you delete an updates policy that is deployed to computers, the values of those updates policy settings are reset to the default state for the operating system that is installed on the computers.

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: For non-Microsoft updates only.
segment.target: For non-Microsoft updates only.

segment.source: Deletes the selected update.
segment.target: Deletes the selected update.

segment.source: Upload
segment.target: Upload

segment.source: Starts the Upload Update wizard that allows you to upload non-Microsoft updates that you want to deploy.
segment.target: Starts the Upload Update wizard that allows you to upload non-Microsoft updates that you want to deploy.

segment.source: To approve updates
segment.target: To approve updates

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Updates > Overview > New updates to approve.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Updates > Overview > New updates to approve.

segment.source: In the Updates workspace, click Overview > New updates to approve.
segment.target: In the Updates workspace, click Overview > New updates to approve.

segment.source: The New updates to approve link appears in the Updates Status area only when there is at least one managed computer that needs an update to be approved.
segment.target: The New updates to approve link appears in the Updates Status area only when there is at least one managed computer that needs an update to be approved.

segment.source: Select an update, review the update properties at the bottom of the page to ensure that you want to approve the update, and then click Approve.
segment.target: Select an update, review the update properties at the bottom of the page to ensure that you want to approve the update, and then click Approve.

segment.source: You can select multiple updates by holding down the CTRL key as you select each item.
segment.target: You can select multiple updates by holding down the CTRL key as you select each item.

segment.source: On the Select Groups page, select a group that you want to deploy the updates to, and then click Add.
segment.target: On the Select Groups page, select a group that you want to deploy the updates to, and then click Add.

segment.source: When you have finished specifying groups, click Next.
segment.target: When you have finished specifying groups, click Next.

segment.source: On the Deployment Action page, do the following for each group in the list:
segment.target: On the Deployment Action page, do the following for each group in the list:

segment.source: On the Approval list, select one of the following:
segment.target: On the Approval list, select one of the following:

segment.source: Required Install - Installs the update on computers in the specified group.
segment.target: Required Install - Installs the update on computers in the specified group.

segment.source: Do Not Install - Reports applicability only and does not install the update.
segment.target: Do Not Install - Reports applicability only and does not install the update.

segment.source: Available Install – The user can install the application on demand from the Company Portal.
segment.target: Available Install – The user can install the application on demand from the Company Portal.

segment.source: Uninstall - Removes updates from computers in the targeted group.
segment.target: Uninstall - Removes updates from computers in the targeted group.

segment.source: The update is removed even if it was not installed by .
segment.target: The update is removed even if it was not installed by .

segment.source: On the Deadline list, select one of the following:
segment.target: On the Deadline list, select one of the following:

segment.source: None - Indicates that no deadline is enforced for the installation of the update and users may decline the update continually.
segment.target: None - Indicates that no deadline is enforced for the installation of the update and users may decline the update continually.

segment.source: As soon as possible - Installs the update at the next opportunity on targeted computers.
segment.target: As soon as possible - Installs the update at the next opportunity on targeted computers.

segment.source: Custom - Specifies the date and time that approved updates are installed.
segment.target: Custom - Specifies the date and time that approved updates are installed.

segment.source: One week, Two weeks, One month – Installs the update within the specified time period.
segment.target: One week, Two weeks, One month – Installs the update within the specified time period.

segment.source: Click Finish to save the settings, or click Cancel to discard the settings and return to the updates list.
segment.target: Click Finish to save the settings, or click Cancel to discard the settings and return to the updates list.

segment.source: Unless the action Do Not Install, Required Install, or Uninstall was explicitly configured for a child group, an action configured for a parent group is inherited by all its children.
segment.target: Unless the action Do Not Install, Required Install, or Uninstall was explicitly configured for a child group, an action configured for a parent group is inherited by all its children.

segment.source: You can check the details pane at the bottom of the All Updates page for reminder messages about the update.
segment.target: You can check the details pane at the bottom of the All Updates page for reminder messages about the update.

segment.source: Need more help?
segment.target: Need more help?

segment.source: For further help and support, see Troubleshoot Endpoint Protection in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For further help and support, see Troubleshoot Endpoint Protection in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune
